revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=September 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = Aubrey Plaza | image = Aubrey Plaza 2012 Shankbone.JPG | caption = Plaza at the [[2012 Time 100]] | birth_name = Aubrey Christina Plaza | birth_date = June 26, 1984 (age 34) | birth_place = [[Wilmington, Delaware]], U.S. | alma_mater = [[New York University]] | occupation = Actress, comedian, producer | years_active = 2004–present | partner = [[Jeff Baena]] (2011–present) }} '''Aubrey Christina Plaza'''{{cite web|last=Plaza|first=Aubrey|url=http://www.bullettmedia.com/article/aubrey-plaza-finally-confronts-her-multiple-personalities/|title=Aubrey Plaza Finally Confronts Her Multiple Personalities|date=March 1, 2012|work=Bullett Magazine }} (born June 26, 1984){{cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2009/aug/03/entertainment/et-plaza3|title=Aubrey Plaza: Funny person|last=Olsen|first=Mark|newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=August 3, 2009}} – interview lists her as 25 is an American comedian and actress. She is known for her starring role as [[April Ludgate]] on the [[NBC]] [[sitcom]] ''[[Parks and Recreation]]'' (2009–2015). After appearing in supporting roles in several feature films, Plaza had her first leading role as Darius Britt in the 2012 comedy film ''[[Safety Not Guaranteed]]''. Since 2017, she has starred as Lenny Busker in the [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] drama series ''[[Legion (TV series)|Legion]]''. Plaza began her career performing [[Improvisational theatre|improv]] and [[sketch comedy]] at the [[Upright Citizens Brigade Theater]]. She later appeared in films such as ''[[Mystery Team]]'' (2008), ''[[Funny People]]'' (2009), ''[[Scott Pilgrim vs. the World]]'' (2010), ''[[Monsters University]]'' (2013), ''[[Life After Beth]]'' (2014), ''[[Grumpy Cat's Worst Christmas Ever]]'' (2014), ''[[Dirty Grandpa]]'' (2016), ''[[Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates]]'' (2016), ''[[The Little Hours]]'' (2017), and ''[[Ingrid Goes West]]'' (2017), the latter two of which she also produced. ==Early life and education== Plaza was born in [[Wilmington, Delaware]], to Bernadette, an attorney, and David Plaza, a financial advisor.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.delawareonline.com/pulpculture/2010/01/15/from-wilmy-to-hollywood/|title=From Wilmy to Hollywood|last=Cormier|first=Ryan|date=January 15, 2010|work=Delaware Online|publisher=[[The News Journal]]}} She has two younger sisters, Renee and Natalie.{{cite web|url=http://www.delawaretoday.com/Delaware-Today/March-2012/Aubrey-Plaza-of-NBCs-Parks-and-Recreation-Wilmington-Native-Is-Building-a-Buzz-in-Hollywood/|title=Aubrey Plaza of NBC’s Parks and Recreation: Wilmington Native Is Building a Buzz in Hollywood|author=John Micklos Jr.|date=February 16, 2012|publisher=Delaware Today}} Plaza was named after the song "[[Aubrey (song)|Aubrey]]" by [[Bread (band)|Bread]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.delawaretoday.com/Delaware-Today/March-2012/Aubrey-Plaza-of-NBCs-Parks-and-Recreation-Wilmington-Native-Is-Building-a-Buzz-in-Hollywood/|title=Aubrey Plaza of NBC’s Parks and Recreation: Wilmington Native Is Building a Buzz in Hollywood|access-date=2018-07-27|language=en}} Her father is [[Puerto Ricans|Puerto Rican]] and her mother is of [[Irish people|Irish]]–[[English people|English]] descent.{{cite web|author=Lee Hernández|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv-movies/girl-slouch-article-1.376882|title=This girl's no slouch|work=New York Daily News |date=June 11, 2009 |accessdate=January 2, 2011}} Plaza has stated: "I was like the only diverse kid in my high school, and I'm half-Puerto Rican. But yeah, I have a huge family and tons of cousins in [[Puerto Rico]]."{{cite web|url=http://www.latina.com/entertainment/tv/parks-recreation-star-aubrey-plaza-explains-why-shes-so-hot-right-now|title=''Parks & Recreation'' star Aubrey Plaza explains why she's so hot right now|last=Herrera|first=Monica|work=[[Latina (magazine)|Latina]]|date=April 9, 2009}} Plaza graduated from [[Ursuline Academy (Delaware)|Ursuline Academy]], an all-girls [[Catholic school]], in 2002, and [[New York University]]'s [[Tisch School of the Arts]] in 2006.{{Cite news|url=http://www.delawaretoday.com/Delaware-Today/March-2012/Aubrey-Plaza-of-NBCs-Parks-and-Recreation-Wilmington-Native-Is-Building-a-Buzz-in-Hollywood/|title=Aubrey Plaza of NBC’s Parks and Recreation: Wilmington Native Is Building a Buzz in Hollywood|access-date=2018-07-27|language=en}} In high school she was student council president and participated in productions with the Wilmington Drama League.{{Cite news|url=http://www.delawaretoday.com/Delaware-Today/March-2012/Aubrey-Plaza-of-NBCs-Parks-and-Recreation-Wilmington-Native-Is-Building-a-Buzz-in-Hollywood/|title=Aubrey Plaza of NBC’s Parks and Recreation: Wilmington Native Is Building a Buzz in Hollywood|access-date=2018-07-27|language=en}}{{cite web|url=https://www.gq.com/story/aubrey-plaza-gq-interview-august-2013|title=The GQ Interview: Aubrey Plaza|author=Mark Byrne,Todd Cole|work=GQ|accessdate=November 9, 2015}} During her second year of college in 2004, Plaza suffered a [[stroke]] that caused temporary paralysis and [[expressive aphasia]]. Since then she has fully recovered.{{Cite news|url=http://www.delawaretoday.com/Delaware-Today/March-2012/Aubrey-Plaza-of-NBCs-Parks-and-Recreation-Wilmington-Native-Is-Building-a-Buzz-in-Hollywood/|title=Aubrey Plaza of NBC’s Parks and Recreation: Wilmington Native Is Building a Buzz in Hollywood|access-date=2018-07-27|language=en}}{{citation|title=interview – "Late Show with David Letterman"|date=August 31, 2011| accessdate=September 1, 2011|last=Letterman|first=David}} ==Career== Plaza has had many [[internship]]s, and worked as an [[NBC page]].{{cite web|title=Aubrey Plaza on the Job That Really Didn't Work Out|url=https://www.elle.com/culture/celebrities/a13969484/aubrey-plaza-worn-emily-spivack-excerpt/|publisher=Elle|accessdate=November 30, 2017}} Plaza has performed [[Improvisational theatre|improv]] and [[sketch comedy]] at the [[Upright Citizens Brigade Theater]] since 2004. She also performed stand-up and has appeared at [[Laugh Factory|the Laugh Factory]] and The Improv. Plaza starred in the online series ''The Jeannie Tate Show'', and starred as Robin Gibney in [[ESPN]]'s ''Mayne Street''. She appeared in the first episode of "Terrible Decisions with [[Ben Schwartz]]" on [[Funny or Die]].{{cite web|url=http://www.funnyordie.com/videos/76b1d33fb0/terrible-decisions-with-ben-schwartz|title=Terrible Decisions with Ben Schwartz from Eric Appel, Ben Schwartz, and Aubrey Plaza |publisher=Funnyordie.com|date=September 27, 2009|accessdate=January 2, 2011|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110101071219/http://www.funnyordie.com/videos/76b1d33fb0/terrible-decisions-with-ben-schwartz|archivedate=January 1, 2011|deadurl=no}} She played [[Seth Rogen]]'s love interest, Daisy, in 2009's ''[[Funny People]]'' directed by [[Judd Apatow]]. She appeared in ''[[Scott Pilgrim vs. the World]]'', and [[Derrick Comedy|Derrick Comedy's]] ''[[Mystery Team]]'', which debuted at 2009 [[Sundance Film Festival|Sundance]]. She appeared in a [[CollegeHumor]] short alongside [[Jason Bateman]] and [[Will Arnett]]. She played [[April Ludgate]] in ''[[Parks and Recreation]]'' from 2009 to 2015. For her performance as the deadpan employee, she received universal praise throughout the entire show, being referred to as one of the show's [[breakout character]]s. [[File:Aubrey Plaza by Gage Skidmore.jpg|thumb|Plaza in 2010]] On March 12, 2010, Plaza performed at "A Night of 140 Tweets: A Celebrity Tweetathon for Haiti", produced by [[Rob Huebel]], [[Paul Scheer]], [[Ben Stiller]], and Mike Rosenstein, at the Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre in Los Angeles. In 2011 she appeared on ''[[Portlandia (TV series)|Portlandia]]''. Plaza appeared as a guest judge during a roast segment on ''[[The Next Food Network Star]]'' in 2011. She appeared in Episode 199 of the ''[[WTF with Marc Maron]]'' podcast. She also had a recurring role as "the Princess" in the comedic sci-fi web series ''Troopers'' on [[CollegeHumor]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.collegehumor.com/troopers|title=Troopers Videos on Collegehumor|work=CollegeHumor|access-date=2018-07-08|language=en-US}} In 2012, she was featured in [[Father John Misty]]'s music video for the song "Hollywood Forever Cemetery Sings" from the album ''[[Fear Fun]]'' and in 2014 she was in Cassorla's "Bona Fide" video where she also made her [[saxophone]]-playing debut.[http://www.baltimoresun.com/entertainment/la-et-ms-watch-aubrey-plaza-sax-solos-cassorla-bona-fide-video-20140107-story.html "Watch Aubrey Plaza rip sax solos in Cassorla's 'Bona Fide' video"]. August Brown, ''[[The Baltimore Sun]]'', January 7th, 2014. Retrieved February 27th, 2018. In 2012 Plaza earned her first starring role in a major film, alongside [[Mark Duplass]], in the comedy, ''[[Safety Not Guaranteed]]''. Plaza played Darius, a jaded intern who answers a curious want ad "seeking a companion for a time traveling adventure". Her performance in the film was critically acclaimed, and Gary Thompson of ''[[The Philadelphia Inquirer]]'' questioned whether this role was out of her usual "pretty slacker" range but found her performance "compelling".{{cite web|last=Thompson|first=Gary|title=Aubrey Plaza shines in ‘Safety Not Guaranteed'|url=http://www.philly.com/philly/entertainment/20120615_Aubrey_Plaza_shines_in__lsquo_Safety_Not_Guaranteed_.html|work=The Philadelphia Inquirer|date=June 15, 2012|accessdate=July 6, 2012|quote=It's too early to say if Plaza's an actress, since no one's asked her to do anything other than be the pretty slacker with the bored posture and world-weary intonation. But she has an unusual kind of beauty (Anglo-Irish, Latina) that the camera loves to explore, and when she does make the hyperspace jump to sincerity and initiative, the results are compelling.}} At the [[2014 Sundance Film Festival]] in January 2014, Plaza's film, ''[[Life After Beth]]'', which was written and directed by her boyfriend Jeff Baena, premiered.{{cite web|url=http://inthemixxshow.com/4143/youll-never-guess-aubrey-plazas-kinky-on-set-ritual|title=You'll Never Guess Aubrey Plaza's Kinky On-Set Ritual!|publisher=In the Mixx|date=October 17, 2013|accessdate=June 26, 2014}} On September 17, 2014, [[Lifetime Network]] announced that Plaza would do the speaking voice of [[Grumpy Cat]] in their upcoming original movie ''[[Grumpy Cat's Worst Christmas Ever]]''.{{cite web|url=http://insidetv.ew.com/2014/09/17/aubrey-plaza-grumpy-cat-lifetime|title=Aubrey Plaza will be the voice of Grumpy Cat in Lifetime movie|last=Blake|first=Emily|date=September 17, 2014|work=Entertainment Weekly|accessdate=September 18, 2014}} She starred in ''[[Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates]]'' alongside [[Zac Efron]], [[Anna Kendrick]] and [[Adam DeVine]]. The film was released on July 8, 2016. Her role as the rebellious Tatiana earned her critical praise. She was a guest star on ''[[Harmonquest|HarmonQuest]]'' in 2016, as a gnome named "Hawaiian Coffee". In 2016, she portrayed [[Aaron Burr]] in the “Hamilton” episode of ''[[Drunk History]]''.{{Cite news|url=http://www.vulture.com/2016/08/see-drunk-historys-new-hamilton-and-burr.html|title=Alia Shawkat and Aubrey Plaza Are Drunk History’s New Hamilton and Burr|work=Vulture|access-date=2018-07-27|language=en}} In 2017, it was announced that Plaza would star in indie comedy ''[[An Evening with Beverly Luff Linn|An Evening With Beverly Luff Linn]]''.{{cite web|last1=McNary|first1=Dave|title=Aubrey Plaza, Emile Hirsch to Star in Indie Comedy ‘An Evening With Beverly Luff Linn’|url=https://variety.com/2017/film/festivals/aubrey-plaza-emile-hirsch-evening-with-beverly-luff-linn-1201981457/|website=Variety|accessdate=February 8, 2017}} She first played the role of Cat Adams in Season 11 of the CBS television show ''[[Criminal Minds]]''. She returned to the role in Season 12. Plaza has been starring in the [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] series ''[[Legion (TV series)|Legion]]'' since 2017. ==Personal life== Plaza has been dating writer and director [[Jeff Baena]] since 2011. They live together in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]] and work together often.{{Cite news|url=https://nypost.com/2017/02/08/aubrey-plaza-like-youve-never-seen-her-before/|title=Aubrey Plaza like you’ve never seen her before|date=2017-02-08|work=New York Post|access-date=2018-07-27|language=en-US}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2017/07/03/jeff-baena-and-aubrey-plazas-medieval-adventure|title=Jeff Baena and Aubrey Plaza’s Medieval Adventure|work=The New Yorker|access-date=2018-07-08|language=en-US}} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- !
